basics.description: **Important:** _This Microsoft Sentinel Solution is currently in public preview. This feature is provided without a service level agreement, and it's not recommended for production workloads. Certain features might not be supported or might have constrained capabilities. For more information, see [Supplemental Terms of Use for Microsoft Azure Previews](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/)._ **Note:** _There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing._ This [Synack](https://www.synack.com/) - Microsoft Sentinel integration synchronizes exploitable vulnerability data from the [Synack Client Portal](https://login.synack.com/) to Microsoft Sentinel. The integration automatically creates incidents in Microsoft Sentinel for each vulnerability and keeps the incident up to date with the latest changes to the vulnerability. Microsoft Sentinel Solutions provide a consolidated way to acquire Microsoft Sentinel content like data connectors, workbooks, analytics, and automations in your workspace with a single deployment step. **API Integrations:** 1 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

options.text: This Synack solution provides the capability to sync exploitable vulnerability data from the Synack Client Portal to Microsoft Sentinel. It deploys an Azure Function that will periodically connect to the Synack Client Portal to synchronize exploitable vulnerability data to Microsoft Sentinel incidents.

This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to Synack to synchronize Synack Vulnerabilities to Microsoft Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the Azure Functions pricing page for details.
Register an application and configure it to allow contribution to Microsoft Sentinel
From the Azure Portal, navigate to App Registrations and create a new app registration. Make sure to copy the Application (client) ID. You will need it on the next step.

options.text: To authenticate to the Sentinel Management API, grant Sentinel Contributor permissions to the application in the IAM setting of the Resource Group where Microsoft Sentinel has been built. Go to Resource Group -> Access control (IAM) -> Role assignments
